title: Compilation panicked

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: NLL-fixed-by-NLL
labels.description: Bugs fixed, but only when NLL is enabled.

body:
Compilation exited abnormally when compiling [this code](https://github.com/gcao/gene.rs/blob/f861fba0d25f6a6de2f01a680bd39eebcf40b7e2/src/compiler.rs#L162)
I know my code has a lot of issues but the compiler should either pass or fail instead of panicking

Steps to reproduce
git clone https://github.com/gcao/gene.rs.git
cd gene.rs
git checkout f861fba0d25f6a6de2f01a680bd39eebcf40b7e2
cargo build

The previous commit compiles fine. The changes in the commit can be found here:
https://github.com/gcao/gene.rs/commit/f861fba0d25f6a6de2f01a680bd39eebcf40b7e2

>

> note: compiler flags: -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental
> 
> note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden
